fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently Jira use values from {{cluster.properties}} as is. 
This leads to different problem with values in case of leading/trailing spaces.
Eg:
{noformat}
# This ID must be unique across the cluster
jira.node.id = node1 
{noformat} 
Note there is a space in the end of 'node1 '.

Example of problem
* mismatch of data in {{clusternode}} and {{clusternodeheartbeat}}, which leads to cluster check errors. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Trim all spaces while parsing the file. 
 
h3. Workaround 
Check and clean spaces manually 
{noformat}
grep -E '[a-z0-9]+[ ]+$' application-data/dc/node1/cluster.properties
jira.node.id = node1
{noformat}
fields.summary: As an JIRA Datacenter Administrator I want to trim all spaces in the cluster.properties file

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition


Currently only CSV Importer ("import from external system") available from system configuration allow map "status" field during importing process. Bulk create ("import issues from CSV") available under issues top menu is not able to map "status" field during importing.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to map the "status" field in bulk create during CSV import.


h3. Workaround

Use "import from external system" to map "status" field if needed.
fields.summary: Allow "status" mapping during import issue from CSV

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*
When we do a search/filter based on only one label and the issues shown have multiple labels. When we export the CSV, the multiple labels get exported too into multiple columns.

h3. *Suggested Solution*
Add an option to export all the labels or just the one we searched. 

h3. *Why this is important*
# This will produce a clean and neat CSV. 
# Lesser work to re-edit the file and most of the time, it is not feasible to do so.
fields.summary: To allow CSV to export one issue label instead of multiple labels into multiple columns

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When an Administrator invites a user in JIRA(via User Management) -this will send an email address to the user. In the invite form, the Administrator will be able to choose which Application Access will be granted to the new user once the user set up the user account following the steps in the invitation email notification. However, once the new user has set up the account, the Application access will be always to the default Application access - anything else that has been chosen by the Administrator before sending the invitation email notification will be ignored.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install and provide the license key for JIRA Service Desk, JIRA Software, and JIRA Core under {{Versions & licenses}} page.
# Navigate to {{Application access}} page and click on _Set defaults for new users_. Set JIRA Service Desk to be the only default Application access.
# Setup Outgoing Mail - can be any Mail server. This will be used by JIRA to send the invitation email.
# Navigate to {{User Management}} page and click on _Invite user_.
# Provide a valid email address and make sure *only JIRA Core* has been chosen for the Application access. This means the new user will have only JIRA Core Application access.
# Click on _Invite users_ button.
# Wait for a few for a moment for the email to be sent and then, check the inbox of the email address that you have provided before. Click on the _Sign Up_ button in the email and fill it all the required information.
# Click on the _Sign Up_ button.
# Login to JIRA with JIRA Administrator permission and check if the Application access of the newly created user.

h3. Expected Results
The new user will have JIRA Core application access (this is the setting that the Admin configured before sending the invitation email).

h3. Actual Results
The new user is configured to have the JIRA Service Desk Application access (the default Application access).
fields.summary: Inviting user via email is setting the user's Application access to the default Application access

fields.description:
Note, this affects all server installations (Bamboo, Confluence etc).

It would be great if the upgrade notes could include copy/paste URLs for updates. Currently when I want to update, I have to go through an extra bunch of steps:
 # Go to download page
 # Change the OS version from Windows to Linux
 # Click download
 # Accept the download in my browser
 # Cancel the download in my browser
 # Copy the download URL link from my browser to my server
 # Download from my server

It would be great to skip steps 2-6!
fields.summary: Provide copy/paste download URLs for updates

fields.description:
Situation: 

We use an external Identity Provider, which also manages users' passwords. Enabling External User Management removes successfully the hyperlinks for users to reset their passwords as this should be done in the external Identity provider itself. A copy of the users' information is kept in a User Directory in Jira and so this Directory is writable. 

Issue:

The forgot password URL is still available allowing people to successfully reset their passwords in JIRA. However this password is stored in JIRA, not in the external identity provider and so the actual password they need to use to login has not been changed. 

Desired outcome:

The reset password URL can be disabled in Jira (and Confluence) configuration settings.
fields.summary: External User Management enabled gives a 500 error at the Forgot password url

h3. Summary
Customers using Postgres 9.3 trying to remove an options used by _Checklist for Jira_ custom field encounters an error:

{noformat}
(ERROR: operator does not exist: numeric ~~ bigint
{noformat}

The same problem is partially fixed by [JRASERVER-20554|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-20554]. This one was never discovered.

Internally, the add-on is using the findByLike method of the OfBiz delegator to clean up data in the CustomFieldValue table when an option is delete.

Affects Jira versios: 7.2.0 - 7.9.0

See logs for more details
fields.summary: OfBiz operations fail with "ERROR: operator does not exist" when JIRA is connected to Postgres

fields.description:
We've had a number of users across our organisation request the ability to import/bulk create issues via a CSV import - this is a great way to not only onboard new teams but also empower them to take ownership of the backlog creation and refinement in a Jira project.

Currently the only way to import/create issues in bulk is through the Global Administrators, but this task is becoming much more regular for teams whether creating a whole new collection of issues, or updating a number of them.

Having users wait for a System Admin to action such a task is a blocker for many teams so limiting this functionality is just plain restrictive.

Offering this functionality via a project admin or permission scheme would be a much more practical way to manage these tasks
fields.summary: Enable the Bulk Import and Updating of Issues via CSV for non-System Admin users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7020].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 26 May 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this feature request.
 
We are in the early stages of a sustained investment in simplifying project configuration and making it easier for individual project owners to maintain their projects. Our goal is to help teams get JIRA projects that are tuned to meet their needs, make it easy for anyone to set up a JIRA project, and reduce the amount of repetitive configuration work that JIRA administrators need to do.

At the same time, we are committed to maintaining the power and controls that JIRA provides to administrators to achieve standardization across projects and shared configurations.

We see templates as the most viable solution for delivering this capability; however it's critical that we build templates as part of the larger system of setting up and maintaing projects, and we need to ensure this system can also meet our goals around making JIRA project configuration simple and accessible for everyone.

So while we do expect to provide templates at some point in the future, it's part of a much larger set of improvements that will span a significant period of time. Thanks for your patience while we work to make JIRA better. We will update this issue as we have more information.

If you're looking for an immediate solution, there are a number of add-ons in the Atlassian Marketplace for JIRA Server:
* [Configuration Manager for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.botronsoft.jira.configurationmanager]
* [Project Creator for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.wittified.jira.project-creator]
* [Gaia for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/ca.nuum.gaia]
* [Project Configurator|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.awnaba.projectconfigurator.projectconfigurator]

Unfortunately I am not aware of any add-ons for JIRA Cloud to support this, but I will update this issue if one becomes available.
 
Cheers,

Dave
JIRA Product Management
dmeyer@atlassian.com
{panel}

*Original request description:*
 
This will allow admins to have a project template that can be copied each time a new project is selected. This will save the admins time from associating new projects with schemes after creation.
 
One way to implement this would be to create 'project schemes’.
fields.summary: Allow support for project schemes or templates

fields.description:
*Background:*

JIRA includes JIRA Importers Plugin (JIM). This is what provides the import functions seen in JIRA Administration "External System Import"
 * This includes options to import from CSV, JSON, FogBugz, Mantis, and others.

JIRA includes custom fields and the ability for custom fields to be "managed" or "locked." These are fields that are created by JIRA Applications or plugins. They are locked to prevent them from being changed.

*Problem Behavior:*

Import using JIRA Importers Plugin is capable of adding new options to locked custom fields.

*Expected Behavior:*

Locked fields cannot be modified by import. Field must be unlocked in order for it to be modified through UI or through any method except for those provided by the plugin or application that is managing the field.

*Example problem caused by this behavior:*

During import the Epic Status custom field gets modified to include additional options. This causes JIRA Software boards to show epics that are marked as "Done"
 * See [Epics marked as Epic Status = Done continue to appear on the Agile Board |https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/epics-marked-as-epic-status-done-continue-to-appear-on-the-agile-board-779158631.html] for additional details regarding this behavior.

*Steps to reproduce*

Reproduced in 7.9.1 with JIM 8.0.10.
 * Create new instance with JIRA Software project
 * Create CSV for importing, include Epic Status and at least one issue with Epic Status of "Open"
 * Import CSV - On the field selection screen map the CSV Epic Status field to the Epic Status field in JIRA (do not map field value)
 * Observe that new option has been added to the locked Epic Status custom field. This "Open" option causes the behavior described in the KB article linked above.
fields.summary: JIRA External System Import (JIM) can create new options for locked custom fields

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As covered in the Bug Report:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33631

["Change Transition 'Submit' Button" | https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/change-transition-submit-button-779160853.html] KB article is not relevant or useable past Jira 5.0, and needs to be pulled down.
 
h3. Environment
Jira Server and Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
- [Following the KB article | https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/change-transition-submit-button-779160853.html]
(Note: You must add a screen to the transition: [Mapping a Screen to a Workflow Transition|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/mapping-a-screen-to-a-workflow-transition-720634253.html])
{panel}
 * *g+g* > _Workflows_
 * Locate the Workflow to modify and click on *Edit*
 * Click on the link for the Transition you wish to Edit 
 * Click *View Properties* button
 ** To Inherit the Name of the Transition:
 *** Delete the *jira.i18n.submit* key
 ** To Customize the "Submit" button:
 *** Specify the _Property key_ of *jira.i18n.submit*
 *** Specify custom value to _Property Value_**
 *** Click *Add*{panel}


h3. Expected Results
Submit button would be changed based on key/value pair.

h3. Actual Results
Submit button is not changed from transition name or to supplied key/value pair As covered in the BUG report no longer works after Jira 5.0

h3. Notes
Tested on versions 7.4, 7.6, 7.8, and 7.9.

h3. Workaround
Change the transition name instead of the key/value pair.
fields.summary: "Change Transition 'Submit' Button" article needs to be pulled down.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA 7.9 ignore the minimum downgrade version shown from the entities.xml file.
{code:java}
grep jira.downgrade.minimum.version entities.xml
     jira.downgrade.minimum.version                : 7.1.2
{code}
{code:java}
grep '<OSPropertyString id="14"' entities.xml
    <OSPropertyString id="14" value="7.1.2"/>
{code}
h3. Environment
 * JIRA 7.9.0 and Postgres database

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a new JIRA 7.9.0 instance and export an XML backup out
 # Install a new JIRA 7.1.2 instance and import 7.9.0 XML backup
 # Failed with the error message:
{code:java}
2018-04-27 18:59:16,929 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 INFO admin 1139x181x1 1olypsh 10.60.2.117 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.OfbizImportHandler] Failed to parse value for element UpgradeTaskHistoryAuditLog.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: [GenericDelegator.makeValue] could not find entity for entityName: UpgradeTaskHistoryAuditLog
..
org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericModelException: Could not find definition for entity name UpgradeTaskHistory
{code}

or stopped at 20% with the following message in the UI:

!xml-error.jpeg!
 and without any error message in logs:
{code:java}
2018-04-25 12:52:09,871 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 INFO d.munjiza 771x3298x1 rv21qs 10.1.112.12 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Importing data is 20% complete...
{code}
h3. Expected Results

It should to be able to downgrade as per entry from entities.xml file
h3. Actual Results

Failed with errors above.
h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment.

h3. Notes
This bug doesn't appear when when importing XML backup with lower version (tested with 7.2.6)
fields.summary: JIRA 7.9.0 ignore minimum downgrade version

fields.description:
h3. Summary
While DC is put under load project cache is sometimes not replicated on some nodes. It is not even eventually consistent - the project is still not visible long after load is gone.

h3. Environment
This is DC specific only

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Generate load on all nodes (constant load over time, causes many hits on project cache e.g. view issue, view boards, view gadgets)
 # Create project on one of the nodes
 # Verify if the project is visible on all other nodes
 # Repeat steps 2 and 3

h3. Actual Results
 At some point of time project is not replicated on some node. It will not replicate even after long time when load is gone.
 
h3. Expected Results
Project is always eventually replicated on all nodes.

h3. Note
* The same behaviour was present since the beginning of Jira DC
* *Root cause*: There was a race condition when receiving cache replication call on the nodes. If node was busy loading cache value it would ignore incoming cache invalidation calls and a newly loaded value (already stall) would be left in cache indefinitely. That's why it was rarely happening: only during certain load and only on some nodes. Note projects cache is just example here - _it could happen to any cache_. 

h3. Workaround
Create yet one more project on a node that has problem. Then cache gets flushed and all projects are visible again.

h3. Fix
Stop ignoring incoming cache replication request while loading cache
fields.summary: A newly created project isn't always visible when JIRA DC is under high load due to race condition

fields.description:
Currently all defined link types are available for all JIRA projects. It leads to some difficulties when somebody tries to link one issue to another if we have a lot of link types. The person has to search the correct link type from multitude. But frequently some specific link types are only used for some specific projects.

So, we would like you to implement an ability to define accessibility of link types for specific projects. For instance, it can be done in following modes:
 # Default (accessible for all projects)
 # Accessible for specific projects (a, b, c, etc.)
 # Accessible for all projects excluding specific (a, b, c, etc.)
fields.summary: Link types differentiation by projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Jira Server Security Overview documentation does not include Cookie-based authentication as an option under https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/security-overview/


h3. Suggested Solution
Update Jira Server Security Overview to include REST API Cookie-based authentication.    

h3. Notes
The [equivalent Jira Cloud page|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/security-overview/] includes Cookie-based authentication as an option, but this is not present in the Jira Server docs.  
* This is being deprecated in Jira Cloud. This is not deprecated in Jira Server.  

We have documented examples for Jira Server, see [Jira REST API example cookie-based authentication|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/jira-rest-api-example-cookie-based-authentication-37234858/] for details.  
* A similar documentation update was tracked under [JRASERVER-44654|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44654].
fields.summary: Add Cookie based authentication to Jira Server Documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Custom avatars do not show up under project avatars on other projects if the avatar was uploaded to one project.
h3. Environment

Jira 7.9.1 and Jira 7.7.2
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a Project in Jira, load the Project settings page.
 # Under this page, go to the Details tab.
 # Change the avatar for the project by clicking the select image page and upload a custom avatar to use.
 # Go to another project and repeat steps 1 and 2.
 # Go to change your avatar on the 2nd project.
 # The custom avatar you uploaded is not viewable in the UI.

h3. Expected Results

You can upload the avatars into the {{jira-home/data/avatars}} folder and they would be viewable in the Jira UI.
h3. Actual Results

These custom avatars are not viewable unless you select 1 custom avatar and upload it to the project, but that avatar will still not be viewable in the 2nd project, which can cause confusion.
h3. Notes

Tested this on Jira 7.7.2 and 7.9.1 and the behavior persisted. Permissions for the custom avatars were the same as default avatars.
h3. Workaround

Upload each avatar manually any time you change the project avatar.
fields.summary: Custom avatars do not show up under project avatars on other projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Jira Server REST API should allow to expand issueType in /rest/api/2/project endpoint

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if the expand option on this REST call would allow 'issueType' to be listed here.   Right now only "description,lead,url,projectKeys" can be expanded in this call.

h3. Why this is important
Jira Cloud's REST call for this specific endpoint specifically allows for expand this option.  See https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/#api-api-2-project-get for details.

This call can be very useful to quickly find both a listing of all projects as well as all the issue types that are available to each project.

h3. Workaround 
You can still find this information via REST using the [GET /rest/api/2/project/\{projectIdOrKey\}|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/7.9.1/#api/2/project-getProject] endpoint.  The problem is that you have to provide a specific project id or key for each project to find this.  This makes it more tedious to find this information in Server, whereas in Cloud, you can find all this in a single call.
fields.summary: Jira Server REST API should allow to expand issueType in /rest/api/2/project endpoint

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
Due to the new GDPR compliance requirement, we are required to change user name. But, changing user name did not update mentions [~name] in description and comments

h3. *Environment*
JIRA Version : Tested on JIRA 7.9

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
# @Mention some name in Comment or Description
# Update user name to a new name 
# Check the ticket for the mention, it will show old username being mention

h3. *Expected Results*
# Mentioned name update accordingly

h3. *Actual Results*
# Mention does not update, it still using old username at mention in comment and description

h3.*Workaround*
# Update all the old username to new username from jiraaction table
{code}
UPDATE [jiradb7.8.1].dbo.jiraaction SET actionbody = '[~myNameToUpdate]' WHERE cast(actionbody as nvarchar(max)) = '[~NewName]'
{code}
fields.summary: [GDPR compliance] Changing User Name Does Not Update Mentions [~name] in Description and Comments

fields.description:
The following translations errors have been reported in JIRA 1. The term "issue" is inconsistently translated to "asia", "ongelma", or "kirjaus". Please pick one translation and stick with that. 2. The tooltips of opsbar buttons end with e.g. "( Tyyppi 'a' )" to indicate a key that the user can press. However, "Tyyppi" in Finnish is a noun, as in "the type" of something, never a verb. This should be "( Paina 'a' )" or "( Näppäile 'a' )" instead. Example:
  • Aseta käsittelijä
    • 3. At /secure/admin/ViewApplicationProperties.jspa, there is a note below the list of installed languages: "Lisäkielipaketteja voi asentaa yllä olevan Liitännäiset-välilehden kautta." However, the tab is actually labeled "Lisäosat", not "Liitännäiset". Appending "?i18ntranslate=on" to the URL shows that the ID of the note is admin.generalconfiguration.internationalisation.description, and the ID of the tab is admin.menu.system.plugins. 4. "Sinulla on tilapäinen pääsy ylläpito toimintoihin." should be written with a compound word, "ylläpitotoimintoihin". This is part of the string whose ID is websudo.enabled.message.
fields.summary: Error in Finnish translations

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira automated backup might cause OutOfMemoryError (OOM) due to large dataset generated during export.

{panel:title=Note| borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
(!) For production use or large JIRA application installations, it is strongly recommended that you use native database-specific tools instead of the XML backup service. XML backups are not guaranteed to be consistent, as the database may be updated during the backup process. Inconsistent backups are created successfully without any warnings or error messages, but fail during the restore process. Database-native tools offer a much more consistent and reliable means of storing data.
{panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Run Backup service and export data into xml.

h3. Expected Results
System is stable

h3. Actual Results
Jira has memory pressure which causes poor performance or leads to *OutOfMemoryError*. 
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2018-04-17 01:02:10,461 Caesium-1-4 ERROR anonymous    Backup Service [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultExportService] Error during Active Objects Backup
com.atlassian.activeobjects.spi.ActiveObjectsImportExportException: There was an error during import/export with <unknown plugin>:
        at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ImportExportErrorServiceImpl.newImportExportSqlException(ImportExportErrorServiceImpl.java:26)
        at com.atlassian.dbexporter.jdbc.JdbcUtils.withNoAutoCommit(JdbcUtils.java:57)
        at com.atlassian.dbexporter.exporter.DataExporter$1.call(DataExporter.java:52)
        at com.atlassian.dbexporter.exporter.DataExporter$1.call(DataExporter.java:49)
        at com.atlassian.dbexporter.jdbc.JdbcUtils.withConnection(JdbcUtils.java:28)
        at com.atlassian.dbexporter.exporter.DataExporter.export(DataExporter.java:49)
        at com.atlassian.dbexporter.DbExporter.exportData(DbExporter.java:49)
        at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsBackup.save(ActiveObjectsBackup.java:110)
        at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultExportService.exportActiveObjects(DefaultExportService.java:184)
...
Caused by: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
        at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.reuseAndReadPacket(MysqlIO.java:3512)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.reuseAndReadPacket(MysqlIO.java:3459)
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
* See related KB: [OutOfMemory Error or Poor Performance due to XML Backup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/outofmemory-error-or-poor-performance-due-to-xml-backup-213057694.html]

h3.Workaround
Delete *Backup service*, see docs: [Automating JIRA application backups|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/automating-jira-application-backups-938847675.html]
fields.summary: Jira automated backup might cause OutOfMemoryError due to large dataset

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*
As time goes, JIRA instance is growing rapidly causing inactive users or projects, unused custom fields or permission scheme.

h3. *Suggested Solution*
Provide an auto-cleanup of those items or display a list of them.

h3. *Why this is important*
For maintenance purposes and keeping the system load at it's minimal. 

h3. *Workaround*
There is a third-party add-on available: [Cleaner for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/co.uk.jackgraves.jira-optimiser/server/overview].
fields.summary: Cleaner for JIRA

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:
In any case where there is a lot of Development Tools information is related to a JIRA ticket such as; builds, commit, PR, or environtments, JIRA would throw the stack trace below:
{noformat}
2018-04-04 00:15:00,850 devstatus.applink:thread-1 WARN flarsson 528x7987130x1 asdacas xxx.xx.x.xx,xxx.xx.x.xxx,127.0.0.1 /rest/dev-status/1.0/issue/summary [c.a.j.p.d.p.source.cache.CachingProviderDecorator] JSON for issue 47781 is too big. It's size is 38413
2018-04-04 00:15:02,669 devstatus.applink:thread-1 WARN flarsson 528x7987130x1 asdacas xxx.xx.x.xx,xxx.xx.x.xxx,127.0.0.1 /rest/dev-status/1.0/issue/summary [c.a.j.p.d.p.source.cache.CachingProviderDecorator] JSON for issue 45796 is too big. It's size is 33928
2018-04-04 00:15:07,607 http-nio-8080-exec-3 ERROR anonymous 14x8806467x3 asdacas xxx.xx.x.xx,xxx.xx.x.xxx,127.0.0.1 /rest/dev-status/1.0/webhooks/update-summary [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: com.atlassian.jira.entity.property.FieldTooLongJsonPropertyException: Value specified for field 'json' is too long: 32771 > 32768
com.google.common.util.concurrent.UncheckedExecutionException: com.atlassian.jira.entity.property.FieldTooLongJsonPropertyException: Value specified for field 'json' is too long: 32771 > 32768
{noformat}
This is causing unnecessary noise in the logs and could cause misunderstanding to the Admin as one of it is being mentioned as ERROR.

h3. Suggested Solution:
To set all the stack trace as WARN or to have it removed completely as it is harmless.

h3. Notes.
* The stack trace was actually thrown due to the code has a condition where the JSON body is more than 32kb, it will throw such stack trace in the logs. It is not due to the value has reached the Database Column limit.
* While there is an ERROR, the information itself is inserted into the database.
* These stack traces are harmless as the information is inserted into the database.
* To reduce the logging level which is to exclude the stack trace above to be written, the packages that the logging level that can be adjusted is:
{code}
com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.provider.source.cache.CachingProviderDecorator
com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.error.jersey
com.atlassian.jira.entity.property
{code}
fields.summary: JIRA Development Status Logging Improvements

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Method {{com.atlassian.jira.project.version.VersionCustomFieldStore#getCustomFieldsUsing}} is slow for Jira instance with large {{customfieldvalue}} table. This is caused by slow and non-optimal SQL executed by the code:
{code:java}
select CUSTOM_FIELD_VALUE.customfield, CUSTOM_FIELD.cfname, count(distinct CUSTOM_FIELD_VALUE.issue)
from public.customfieldvalue CUSTOM_FIELD_VALUE
left join public.customfield CUSTOM_FIELD
on CUSTOM_FIELD_VALUE.customfield = CUSTOM_FIELD.id
where CUSTOM_FIELD_VALUE.numbervalue = ? and (CUSTOM_FIELD.customfieldtypekey = ? or CUSTOM_FIELD.customfieldtypekey = ?)
group by CUSTOM_FIELD.cfname, CUSTOM_FIELD_VALUE.customfield
{code}
h3. Environment
 * Large Jira instance. Specific table {{customfieldvalue}} has 50M+ rows.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Execute {{getCustomFieldsUsing}} method. One of the ways: trigger {{/rest/api/2/version/<VerID>/relatedIssueCounts}} REST API call
h3. Expected Results

Execution is fast: ~ seconds
h3. Actual Results

Execution is slow: 3 minutes
h3. Notes
 * Also note, that deleting any version from Release page will take a really long time for large instance. This includes:
 ** Deleting version without issues associated to it
 ** Deleting version with some issues associated to it

Steps:
 # Go to _Releases_ page of a project
 # Try to delete any version

 * Before deleting the version at Releases view, Jira calls {{/rest/api/2/version/<VerID>/relatedIssueCounts}} to check if version can be deleted. This call triggers {{com.atlassian.jira.project.version.VersionCustomFieldStore#getCustomFieldsUsing}}, which takes a long time to complete.

h3. Workaround

Add a database index to customfieldvalue.numbervalue, for example:
{code:java}
create index customfieldvalue_number_value_type_key on customfieldvalue (numbervalue)
{code}
This should improve the performance of these calls, *however* we estimate editing custom fields will take longer as a result of adding these database indexes. As such we strongly advice testing the impact of this change in a staging environment before applying in production

In newer Jira versions, there exists an optimization for the edge case when there are no version picker custom fields. For more info see [JRASERVER-68497|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-68497]
fields.summary: method VersionCustomFieldStore.getCustomFieldsUsing is very slow for large instances due to constructed SQL

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Cluster Locks healthcheck in the Troubleshooting and support tools section in Administration panel consistently fails with the following error:
{code:java}
Exception during health check invocation java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/atlassian/beehive/db/spi/ClusterLockStatus
{code}
It *always* fails in the affected Jira versions, even if the cluster locks are fine. Problem is caused due to refactoring the related {{ClusterLockStatus}} code.

h3. Environment
* Jira Datacenter  

h3. Expected Results
No errors when the cluster locks work.

h3. Actual Results
It *always* fails in the affected Jira versions, even if the cluster locks are fine.
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-24 at 10.37.27.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
* The failing healthcheck results in a popup (visible only to Jira admins) when logging it - the admin can click "Don't show me this again" to prevent them from popping up again.
* The issue will be fixed in the *Atlassian Troubleshooting and Support Tools* system plugin update (ATST). Admins will be able to update the plugin without the need to update their entire Jira instance.

h3.Workaround
* There is currently no workaround.
fields.summary: Cluster lock healthcheck fails with NoClassDefFoundError

fields.description:
Searches in Jira heavily rely on Lucene indexes which could have slow access after some time due to the introduced fragmentation of daily operations in index documents - e.g. updating issues, commenting, etc.

It would be great to have some kind of check built into Jira to check the current distribution of segments and recommend the execution of a foreground reindex option - which has an optimization phase that will combine all segments into a single one.

We could also link this to the new standalone optimization process suggested in [JRASERVER-67194|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-67194].
fields.summary: Introduce check of "fragmentation" in Lucene indexes

fields.description:
A big part of making index searches fast in Jira is ensuring we have the indexes divided into as little segments as possible (less fragmentation), and currently we only put all documents into a single segment in a "Lock Jira and rebuild indexes" process through an {{optimize()}} call.

We should have an option for Jira administrators to call {{optimize()}} apart from a foreground reindex, since this _should_ be a faster approach with the same end-result. This way it is possible to run a background reindex and optimize later.

The {{optimize()}} call, however, should still lock Jira (using a Johnson page?) as this holds the write lock of indexes for an extended period of time and could cause searches or updates to fail.

We should also inform the administrator that this process *will not* correct corrupted indexes - perhaps not even allow its use should we detect corruption like we do with background reindex.

h4.  Note on fix
Jira 8.0 has new Lucene 7 and doesn't need {{optimize()}} as it is done automatically.
fields.summary: Introduce Johnsoning optimization process for Lucene indexes

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
When setting JIRA Whitelist with *Mozilla Firefox* with wildcard "*" Expression, with "Allow Incoming" ticked will caused "type" set to "Domain Name".
(i) http://www.mylocalhost.com:8080/*
(i) Only happen on Firefox, was working fine on Chrome.

h3. *Environment*
JIRA Version : Tested on JIRA 7.9, 7.8.1 on Mozilla Firefox
(i) Only happen on firefox

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
# Open Firefox browser (Tested on latest version and able to reproduce)
# Setup a wildcard expression whitelist in JIRA
(i) http://www.goo.com:8080/*
# Tick allow incoming
# Type was forced to wrong type.

h3. *Expected Results*
Type was identified as "Wildcard Expression" instead of "Domain Name*

h3. *Actual Results*
Type was identified as "Domain Name", this issue also happen when we edit the "Type"

h3.*Workaround*
# Use Google Chrome
# If issue happen during you update the "Type", try to delete the whitelist and re-setup it with correct "Type" (Use Chrome)
fields.summary: Setting JIRA Whitelist with Mozilla Firefox with wildcard "*" Expression, with "Allow Incoming" ticked will caused "type" set to "Domain Name".

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Line spacing between lines is being added when we add text formatting on the parent list.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a comment as such (Text Mode):
{noformat}
* Heading 1 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm
** Heading 1.1 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm
** Heading 1.2 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm
*** Heading 1.2.1 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm
*** Heading 1.2.2 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm
* Heading 2 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm
** Heading 2.1 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm
{noformat}
# Switch it to Visual Mode.
# Highlight the {{Heading 1.2 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm}} line and bold it.
# Observe that there is a line spacing added below the line.
# Highlight the {{Heading 2 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm}} line and apply font color.
# Observe that there is a line spacing added below the line.

(i) This happens even if we add the text formatting manually in the Text Mode as well. For example, for the line {{Heading 1.2 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm}}, we can change it to {{\*Heading 1.2 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm\*}} to manually add the formatting and the behaviour is still the same. Pointing out that this is nothing to do with the Visual Mode.

h3. Expected Results
{quote}
* Heading 1 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm
** Heading 1.1 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm
** Heading 1.2 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm
*** Heading 1.2.1 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm
*** Heading 1.2.2 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm
* Heading 2 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm
** Heading 2.1 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm
{quote}
Same line spacing with bold Heading 1.2 and red Heading 2.

h3. Actual Results
{quote}
* Heading 1 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm
 ** Heading 1.1 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm
 ** *Heading 1.2 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm*
 *** Heading 1.2.1 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm
 *** Heading 1.2.2 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm
 * {color:#d04437}Heading 2 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm{color}
 ** Heading 2.1 asdfghjklqwertyuiopzxcvbnm
{quote}

h3. Workaround
Go to : ⚙ > System > Announcement banner > add the text below > for all logged in users > Set Banner

{code}
<style type="text/css">
ol{
    margin: 0 0 0 0;
}
</style>
{code}
fields.summary: Adding text formatting on a nested bullet list is adding line spacing between the lines

fields.description:
h5. BACKGROUND

With JRASERVER-65602 the "Disable Empty JQL Query" option was added. However, when a user performs an empty search with this option enabled, they encounter the following message:

{quote}
No issues have been created (yet)
Be the first to create an issue
{quote}

h5. SUGGESTION

It would be great if, instead, users encountered an encouraging - and less misleading - message, such as "Start by filtering your query" or "Type in some JQL to get started"
fields.summary: "Disable Empty JQL Query" option shows "No issues have been created" dialogue

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 1. Install Jira Service Desk
 2. Install Structure plugin
 3. Disable Structure for user _X_ (or project _P_)
 4. Try to create or edit queue on JSD page under _X_ (or for project _P_)
 There will be JavaScript errors due to some resources are not available on the page.

Structure plugin disables its resources on a page where it should not be shown by resource condition under the context (corresponding to the page). Structure resources are depends on Jira core resources (for example _jira.webresources:jqlautocomplete_). JSD depends on _jira.webresources:jqlautocomplete_ also but this resource is finally excluded from the _batch.js_ for the _jira.project.sidebar_ context.

It looks like a race between include and exclude (by condition) resources from different plugins for the same page context

~_Note: installing Structure plugin first will fix the problem until Structure plugin upgrade/reinstall_~
fields.summary: WRM excludes Jira core resources (required by JSD) from context due to resource condition in a plugin

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the Due Date field value is when Daylight Savings Time (DST) takes place (dependent on the Timezone of instance), issue navigator will meet with an error related to the Due Date field. This is because the field value (E.g.: 30th March) will be affected when the DST takes place.

Error Message:
{code}
An error occurred whilst rendering this message.  Please contact the administrators, and inform them of this bug. Details: ------- org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getHtml' in  class com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.layout.column.ColumnLayoutItemImpl threw exception java.lang.NullPointerException at templates/jira/issue/table/macros.vm[line 117, column 34] at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.handleInvocationException(ASTMethod.java:337) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.execute(ASTMethod.java:284) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.execute(ASTReference.java:262) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.value(ASTReference.java:507) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTExpression.value(ASTExpression.java:71) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTSetDirective.render(ASTSetDirective.java:142) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTBlock.render(ASTBlock.java:72) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.directive.Foreach.performIteration(Foreach.java:393) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.directive.Foreach.render(Foreach.java:316) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTDirective.render(ASTDirective.java:175) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTBlock.render(ASTBlock.java:72) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.directive.VelocimacroProxy.render(VelocimacroProxy.java:212) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.directive.RuntimeMacro.render(RuntimeMacro.java:247)
{code}

{code:borderStyle=solid}
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
    	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.DocumentIssueImpl.getDueDate(DocumentIssueImpl.java:245) [classes/:?]
    	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.DueDateSystemField.getColumnViewHtml(DueDateSystemField.java:320) [classes/:?]
    
{code} 

h3. Expected Results
Displays all the issue like normal

h3. Actual Results
 !DueDate.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
# Hide the column Due Date from the Issue Detail View page.
# Update the Due date to either one day earlier or later.
fields.summary: In issue navigator, Due Date field will cause error if the value is when Daylight Savings Time is in place

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
A client would like to suppress notification email for user @mentions on a specific project. There currently is no way to suppress mentions without the side effect of disabling user-picker functionality across a whole instance

h3. Suggested Solution
Extending the default notification scheme so as to introduce a notification option for user mentions accessible under "Project Configuration" (and globally, too)

h3. Workaround 
Currently there's no workaround to achieve the above on a per-project basis (from Jira, at any rate).

h3. Further notes
Screenshot included to show where the option might be included - basically, the Notifications tab under "Project configuration":
!image-2018-04-19-16-36-19-045.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: On-and-offable mention notification on a per-project basis

fields.description:
Problem Definition

To notify customers of GDPR regulations it would be handy to add a popup message when uploading files


Suggested Solution
Allow the customer to add popup messages when the file upload event (or another event) with custom messages.
fields.summary: Enable to add pop-ups with notification messages when uploading files.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the filter '!=' to exclude issues with a certain custom field values, on top of the excluded values, issues with custom field value "none" will also be excluded.

h3. Steps to replicate
# Create a new project (TEST) with 4 issues
# Create a Custom Field Select List (Single Choice) with options A, B, C
# Assign the Custom Field values to the issues:
{panel}
Issue 1 = None
Issue 2 = A
Issue 3 = B
Issue 4 = C
{panel}
# In issue navigator, apply the filter *project = TEST AND "Custom Field" != B*

h3. Expected Results
Issues 1, 2, and 4 are displayed

h3. Actual Results
Only issues 2, and 4 are displayed

h3.Workaround
Use the filter *project = TEST AND ("Custom Field" != B OR "Custom Field" is EMPTY)*. Then only issues with no values for the custom field are shown
fields.summary: Filter '!=' does not include "None" values

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
When using a custom field (text) with (wiki renderer), the textbox data will be reset when we changing issue type or project. Both issue type and project having same screen field and field configuration. 

(i) This issue does not impact to description (wiki renderer) as it seems had been fixed in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30427
(i) Custom field having the same issue now

h3. *Environment*
JIRA Version : Tested on JIRA 7.9

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
# Create a new project
# Create a custom field text field
# Include the custom field on the screen of the project
# Setup the field configuration of the textbox with wiki style renderer
# Create a new issue for the project
# Enter "some text" in the custom field text field with wiki style renderer 
(i) Not applicable to the description field!
# Change to a different issue type/project

h3. *Expected Results*
The data should remain if both screens showing same custom field and with the same field configuration.

h3. *Actual Results*
It reset to a blank text field.
fields.summary: Losing Custom Field (Text) Data with (Wiki Stype Renderer) during We Changing Issue Type or Projects With Same Field Configuration/Screen.

fields.description:
*THE PROBLEM*

*Bug Part 1*

Email addresses of format 'andré@blah.com' cannot be used with registered Jira users, validation on entry fails.

*Bug Part 2*

Email addresses of format 'andré@blah.com' fails:
{noformat}
InternetAddress ia=new InternetAddress("andré@blah.com");{noformat}
Upgrading javamail will enable a wider range of customers to interact with JIRA.

*THE SOLUTION*

Jira 7.9.x still ships with Javamail v1.5.6, Javamail v1.6.0 specifically adds "Support for internationalized email addresses (RFC 6530/6531/6532)"
 - [https://javaee.groups.io/g/javamail/message/1]

*CONTEXT*

Gmail has support RFC6530 since 2014.
 - [https://www.zdnet.com/article/gmail-to-support-accented-and-non-latin-characters] 

 

@note to Atlassian.  Yes, users won't ever see this or vote for it, that doesn't mean its not critical and something you should just 'not fix'...
fields.summary: Upgrade Javamail to 1.6.0 to support email recipients with non-ascii address characters

fields.description:
h3.Summary
When using the Microsoft Edge Browser, items from the page that are dragged can be dropped onto Jira, which Jira will treat as attachments.

h3.Steps to Reproduce
# Using the Microsoft Edge browser, view a Jira issue
# Drag the comment button, or an avatar of a User
# Drop the item you're dragging onto the Jira image

h3.Expected Results
Nothing happens.

h3.Actual Results
When dragging links or images, Edge will treat those as URL or image files - and then attach them to the ticket, which may be undesirable.

h3.Workaround
Add the following to Jira's announcement banner:
{code}
<script type="text/javascript">
document.ondragstart = function () { return false; };
</script>
{code}

As with all changes to the announcement banner involving Javascript, you might see an XSS Blocked warning message from your browser - that's normal; and your changes should still be saved.

Please ensure you test this change in a test environment first, before applying to production. If you see [unusual behaviour in pages after applying this fix|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-pages-go-hidden-or-blank-after-adding-an-announcement-banner-396298891.html], you may need to remove the adjustments - we also have steps to [remove the announcement banner through the database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-remove-jira-announcement-banner-through-the-database-429916703.html].

The fix prevents the "ondragstart" event. This will stop users from dragging things *off* the Jira page (even to the desktop), but it will not stop users dropping things *onto* the Jira page (which is the behaviour of other browsers). You may not wish to use this workaround if you have large numbers of users who drag links to their bookmarks, desktop or other locations.
fields.summary: Attachment getting added on MS Edge when an element is dropped on any area.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Upgrading from Jira 7.6.X or below to 7.7 or above with a MySQL 5.7.9 - 5.7.17 version encounters failed upgrade tasks caused by MySql BUG:
- https://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=79590

MySQL 5.7.18 and Later do not encounter this issue

h3. Expected Results
MySQL 5.7 is listed as Supported Platform and should not conflict

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the logs:
{code}
<UpgradeTaskHistory id="10300" upgradeTaskFactoryKey="host" buildNumber="77001" status="FAILED" upgradeType="SERVER" />

    <UpgradeTaskHistoryAuditLog id="10400" upgradeTaskFactoryKey="host" buildNumber="77001" status="FAILED" upgradeType="SERVER" timeperformed="2018-03-15 15:02:16.0" action="upgrade" />
    <UpgradeTaskHistoryAuditLog id="10500" upgradeTaskFactoryKey="host" buildNumber="77001" status="FAILED" upgradeType="SERVER" timeperformed="2018-03-15 15:08:19.0" action="upgrade" />
    <UpgradeTaskHistoryAuditLog id="10600" upgradeTaskFactoryKey="host" buildNumber="77001" status="FAILED" upgradeType="SERVER" timeperformed="2018-03-15 15:12:59.0" action="upgrade" />
    <UpgradeTaskHistoryAuditLog id="10700" upgradeTaskFactoryKey="host" buildNumber="77001" status="FAILED" upgradeType="SERVER" timeperformed="2018-03-15 15:19:49.0" action="upgrade" />
    <UpgradeTaskHistoryAuditLog id="10800" upgradeTaskFactoryKey="host" buildNumber="77001" status="FAILED" upgradeType="SERVER" timeperformed="2018-03-19 19:38:05.0" action="upgrade" />
    <UpgradeTaskHistoryAuditLog id="10900" upgradeTaskFactoryKey="host" buildNumber="77001" status="FAILED" upgradeType="SERVER" timeperformed="2018-03-23 20:00:24.0" action="upgrade" />
    <UpgradeTaskHistoryAuditLog id="11000" upgradeTaskFactoryKey="host" buildNumber="77001" status="FAILED" upgradeType="SERVER" timeperformed="2018-03-25 17:11:00.0" action="upgrade" />

h3.Workaround
Upgrade MySQL to version 5.7.18 or later

h3.Suggested Follow Up:
As this is specific to a MySQL bug there is really not a fix Jira Side so we should Update the Documentation to note the conflicting MySQL versions:
* Upgrade notes for 7.7 - 7.9
** https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-release-notes-776821069.html
* Supported platforms
** https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver077/supported-platforms-945532507.html
** https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver078/supported-platforms-947188411.html
** https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/supported-platforms-938846830.html
* [JIRA Software Upgrade Hub | https://confluence.atlassian.com/ug/jira-software-upgrade-hub-933696737.html] under the Known issue section of the *JIRA Software upgrade matrix*:
** https://confluence.atlassian.com/ug/jira-software-upgrade-matrix-933696761.html

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When upgrading the application, the setenv.sh(.bat for Windows) gets overwritten which blows away any values you may have entered in the $JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS variable.
h3. Suggested Solution

Change the documentation to have the customers manually set this environment variable in the OS, and comment out the entry in the setenv script so that it doesn't overwrite the variable when the application starts after an upgrade.
h3. Why this is important
 * A lot of customers set JVM arguments here, and it annoying to have to re-add them every time an upgrade is made.
 * This is close to the same approach being used in the [Bitbucket 5.0+ documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserverkb/how-to-configure-an-outbound-http-and-https-proxy-for-bitbucket-server-779171680.html] for setting this variable.
 * Since we have no plans nor desire to get rid of the setenv script altogether, commenting out the variable is the least obtrusive way to keep it from overwriting the existing value every time you upgrade.

h3. Workaround
 # Set the $JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS environment variable manually in the OS
 # Comment out the variable at the top of the setenv.sh(.bat) 
 (!) You will have to perform the second step after each upgrade prior to starting the application.
fields.summary: Comment out '$JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS' in setenv.sh(.bat)

fields.description:
Hi All,

There has been a request from several of our developers to be able to control the users who can create versions as part of the Permission Scheme.
fields.summary: Addition to Project Permission in the Project Permission Scheme

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*
The user needs to change their workflow from time to time but JIRA requires the user to map the old workflow status to the new workflow status. However, the user wants to retain the old workflow status in old issues while only the newly created issue to use the new workflow. 

h3. *Suggested Solution*
To add an option when publishing a workflow whether to retain old workflow status or not. 

h3. *Why this is important*
The status data integrity is important for users to track back their issue and for reference purposes. 

h3. *Workaround*
# First, duplicate the old workflow. 
# Rename and prepend "old_" to those issue types.
# Assign the copied workflow to those old issue types. 
# Recreate those issue types and assign them to the new workflow.
fields.summary: Retain old workflow status data when publishing new workflow

fields.description:
A create issue button at the bottom or kanban columns would greatly improve user experience for all users and ramp up time for new users.

 
 * If the column only shows one status then you can automatically prefill the status, saving the user a step.
 * This is standard UX users are used to from Trello and most kanban implementations. 
 ** At best it is unintuitive to have to go to the top of the screen to the "Create".  
 ** Worse is being required to navigate to backlog or issues screen that requires extra hoops for a user's brain to jump through and reacquaint themselves to a new display.

 

I believe this is a significant hurdle when a new user goes to use the kanban board. [Here's an example of a user struggling in this scenario|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/How-to-add-an-issue-to-the-Kanban-board-from-the-Kanban-board/qaq-p/22062].
fields.summary: Quick create issue button in Kanban Column

fields.description:
h3. Summary 
Someone who is only an administrator is unable to view Versions in the administration page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new user, remove all the application access but make them an administrator.
# Create a new software project and make them the administrator of that project.
# Take that new project, and change its Browse Project permissions to users only that have Software Application access.
# Now if you go to that Project with the new user, we see an "The JIRA server could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server may be down."

h3.Expected Behaviour 
Should show projects versions
 !Version_Bug1.PNG|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Result
The page loads with the attached image.
 !Version_Bug.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently no known workaround
fields.summary: Administrator without Browse Project permission can not see Versions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Data import from Pivotal Tracker results in various errors e.g. it is not possible to import attachments and time tracking data. This is because Pivotal API has been moved to v5 while Jira is still on v3.

h3. Expected results

As an admin, when I import data from Pivotal Tracker, I am able to import the attachments and time tracking info and there are no errors related to this displayed. 
h3. Actual results

Importing from Pivotal results in various error and failure reports. Attachments are not imported (issues are).
h3. Steps to reproduce

As an admin
 * access the 'External System Import' tool
 * choose the Pivotal Tracker system
 * provide Pivotal credentials and proceed with the wizard
 * based on the projects specified for the import and characteristics of those one may, or may not, run into multiple errors. E.g. an attempt to import project with issues containing attachments results in the issues being imported but the attachments not. 

h3. Possible workaround

Use the CSV export feature in Pivotal and the CSV import feature in Jira. Unfortunately, Pivotal documentation explicitly states that CSV exports do not include attachments.
h3. Probable reason

Pivotal Tracker has released a new API and deprecated the old one. Jira may be still using the later one hence the failures.
h3. Additional notes

This most probably affects all Jira Server versions (if the API deprecation is the root cause).
h2. {color:#333333}Also, there may be more Pivotal import features affected (not only attachments and time tracking) by it. {color}
fields.summary: Multiple errors during Pivotal Tracker data import

fields.description:
h3. +Steps to reproduce+

 # Change the *Header Background Color* to a different color (e.g. Green) from the default one

h3. +Expected behavior+

h3. +Actual behavior+

Only the *Latest upgrade report* page is affected. The new color is respected everywhere else.

h3. Expected Results

 !JIRA771_ok.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Summary  

When trying to create issue, after changing the project, the cursor moves to Description (or other) field if the Description field style is set as Text.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open some project
# Click Create
# Create issue screen opens, make sure Description field style is set as Text
# Change project in Project field

h3. Expected Results
Cursor moves to the first field on the create issue screen.
 
h3. Actual Results
Cursor moves to Description (or some other) field.
!cursor-create-issue.jpeg|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

fields.description:
h3. Summary
To achieve pagination, using the query parameter _startAt_ when calling /rest/api/2/issue/\{issueIdOrKey\}/worklog does not work. Checking the response, startAt is always 0.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue
# Log work to the issue
# Get the worklog for the issue, use a non-zero value for startAt parameter

h3. Expected Results
The result will start from the value placed in startAt.

h3. Actual Results
The response is always the same payload i.e. startAt is always zero (same with maxResults = 50) hence pagination cannot be achieved.

h3. Notes
The _maxResults_ parameter also experiences the same thing i.e. changing it will not reflect in the results.
fields.summary: Query parameter startAt does not work for GET /rest/api/2/issue/{issueIdOrKey}/worklog endpoint

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

If there is a user whose username is in a format like {{foo.bar}} and when we search the user in *Assignee* field with a keyword "bar", user picker doesn't suggest the user. Of course, in case we use a keyword "foo", it suggests the user.
The same user can be suggested in *Reporter* field with both of the keywords.

Background of this suggestion is that some customers use such format for their username. (e.g. {{firstname.lastname}})

I assume that this problem never happen to English customers as they also set their *full name* like "Firstname Lastname" and Assignee field searches Firstname and Lastname separately.
If we search users with keyword "lastname", it will match the Lastname in their full names.

However, Japanese customers (or other countries which use multibyte characters) usually set their full name in their own language like "名　姓" (or "姓　名").
(i) "名" means firstname and "姓" means lastname in Japanese.

That's why, Assignee field doesn't pick the user.

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be better if Assignee field suggests users like Reporter field.
fields.summary: Improve user picker of Assignee field

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
A resolution is set via workflow function. In the next screen, the set resolution is excluded via workflow properties. Since the value is now missing, the Resolution field will be set to the value on top of the list.

h3. Suggested Solution
The resolution field should not be assigned any resolution when the previously set value is missing/excluded.

h3. Workaround 
Do not put any resolution value prior
fields.summary: Resolution should retain no values when default value is not configured

fields.description:
h2. Problem Statement
Index snapshot is being generated when the foreground reindexing passes 90% but it does not shows the progress of the index snapshot and that can be easily perceived as reindexing process being stuck especially when the indexes size is enormous.
{code}
2018-04-17 09:23:52,073 IssueIndexer:thread-5 INFO admin 563x163x1 1wcmjbb 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa [c.a.j.w.a.admin.index.IndexAdminImpl] Re-indexing is 91% complete. Current index: Issue

2018-04-17 09:23:52,185 JiraTaskExectionThread-1 INFO admin 563x163x1 1wcmjbb 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultIndexCopyService] Index backup started. Requesting node: darknode

2018-04-17 09:23:52,396 JiraTaskExectionThread-1 INFO admin 563x163x1 1wcmjbb 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultIndexCopyService] Index backup complete. Snapshot file: IndexSnapshot_10000.zip
{code}

h2. Suggestion
It will be great if there's additional logging for when the index snapshot is being generated to illustrate progress and the reindexing process is not idle.

fields.description:
*Issue:* Allow team members to set their own availability, but not to manage anything else in the plan.

*Use Case:* In larger orgs, the team leads can review the availability but don't want to have to be in charge of the data entry.

Regarding the ability for specific team members to manage the availability, you can go to... 
 * *Portfolio Administration* >> 
 * *Portfolio Permissions* 

...and there you can set which group has access to manage the shared team - although there is no functionality to just allow team members to manage their own weekly hours, but does allow them to set their hours along with the rest of the team. 

!portfolio permission.jpg|thumbnail!

*Actual Result:* This allows the members to manage *all* shared teams, not just ones they're in.

*Desired Result:* This *will not* allow the members to manage *all* shared teams.
fields.summary: Portfolio: Allow team members to set their own availability, but not to manage anything else in the plan.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-6851].
  {panel}


In the custom field configuration context, it is not possible to  choose a project if it has already been associated to another configuration context of the same custom field. For instance, it is not possible to make the following associations:

Task, project1, configuration context 1
Task, project2, configuration context 2
Bug, project1, configuration context 3
Bug, project2, configuration context 4

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Image for URL field when a user adds a custom field did not include an HTTP/HTTPS scheme. This can make user misunderstand that the URL field will accept the URL without HTTP/HTTPS scheme. Currently, the image contains www.jira.com as image example which when we applied to the URL field it will detect as invalid.
 !image-2018-04-17-07-57-07-993.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Edit the image for the URL field to include HTTP/HTTPS scheme as an example.
fields.summary: Include HTTP/HTTPS into the image of URL field

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition: 

The Reporter and Assignee fields default to different positions in a board's detail view vs. issue view.  

In *Detail View* (from board) the order is:

Reporter: _________
Assignee: _________

In the *Issue View* (opening the view in a new tab) the order is the opposite: 

Assignee: _________
Reporter: _________

h3. Suggested Solution

Default order on the Issue View should match the default of the Detail View. 

h3. Why is this important

Currently, it is confusing for users to see a different order, and users can accidentally assign an issue to themselves or change the reporter (thinking they are changing the assignee). Muscle memory comes into play, and users expect the fields to be in the same exact position.  

h3. Work Around

Reconfigure every board to use the same order that the issue view defaults to, as this one is not configurable. However, this is a time consuming and takes a bit of effort to ensure consistency across Jira.  Many board admins wouldn't be aware that this was needed and it's easily missed.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like consistent default positions of Reporter and Assignee fields in all views of Jira so that users are not confused by order changes

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Jira you can enable SQL logging for all DB operations: [ Administration >  System > Logging and profiling > SQL Logging > *Enable the SQL log* ] 
That allows you to see SQL statements produced by Jira methods before execution and also response time. 
After switching part of the code to use *QueryDSL* framework, this logging is no longer present. So there is no way to track the SQL generated by new methods.

h3. Expected Results
Logging similar to OfBiz in {{atlassian-jira-sql.log}} file
{noformat}
2017-11-13 16:45:40,502 http-nio-8081-exec-22 admin 1005x4181x1 czyhc8 /rest/hipchat/integrations/1.0/issuepanel/data/AG-10 1ms "SELECT ID, LINKTYPE, SOURCE, DESTINATION, SEQUENCE FROM public.issuelink WHERE DESTINATION='11101'"
2017-11-13 16:45:40,502 http-nio-8081-exec-22 admin 1005x4181x1 czyhc8 /rest/hipchat/integrations/1.0/issuepanel/data/AG-10 call stack
        ...
        at com.atlassian.jira.entity.SelectQueryImpl$ExecutionContextImpl.forEach(SelectQueryImpl.java:227)
        at com.atlassian.jira.entity.SelectQueryImpl$ExecutionContextImpl.asList(SelectQueryImpl.java:164)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.link.DefaultIssueLinkManager.getLinks(DefaultIssueLinkManager.java:335)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.link.DefaultIssueLinkManager.lambda$new$1(DefaultIssueLinkManager.java:77)
        at com.atlassian.jira.cache.request.RequestCacheImpl.get(RequestCacheImpl.java:42)
        at java.util.Optional.map(Optional.java:215)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.link.DefaultIssueLinkManager.getInwardLinks(DefaultIssueLinkManager.java:327)
        at com.atlassian.jira.config.DefaultSubTaskManager.getParentIssueId(DefaultSubTaskManager.java:288)
{noformat}

h3. Actual Results
No logging in the {{atlassian-jira-sql.log}} file
 
h3. Notes
* Normally logging done by {{com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.LoggingSQLInterceptor}} 

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Jira QueryDSL framework doesn't log SQL statements when logging enabled

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The User Picker in Groups will not retain the selected users when new filter is applied. It proves to be an inconvenience when having to bulk-add many users as the selection will get cleared when new filter is applied.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the User Picker to retain selected users even after new filter is applied.

h3. Workaround 
Have to bulk-add users per filter

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding a Gmail IMAP mail server and incoming mail handler, the following message is logged in my catalina.out multiple times a second:
{noformat}2018-04-13 10:54:42,089 Caesium-1-2 INFO anonymous    gmail-hand [c.a.mail.incoming.mailfetcherservice] Calling handleMessage{noformat}

h3. Environment
* I can reproduce this on-demand in my local 7.6.2 instance
* Colleague can reproduce in 7.4.x
* Customers are seeing this in 7.6.1 and 7.8.0(GHS-112421)


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Gmail IMAP mail server
# Create Core/Software mail handler
# Tail the catalina.out

h3. Expected Results
No diagnostic logging

h3. Actual Results
The below INFO logging is added to the catalina.out file:
{noformat}
2018-04-13 10:54:42,089 Caesium-1-2 INFO anonymous    gmail-hand [c.a.mail.incoming.mailfetcherservice] Calling handleMessage
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
* Jira logs messages at _INFO_ level, while it should at _DEBUG_ for each invocation of {{processMessage}} method, which is for each message. 

h3.Workaround
* Since logging will be added for each message, deleting unnecessary emails ('Mail Delivery failure', Out of Office replies, etc ) will reduce amount of logging. 
* Modify the {{$JIRA_HOME/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/log4j.properties}} file to set the com.atlassian.mail.incoming.mailfetcherservice class to only log at WARN level.
{code:borderStyle=solid}
# ADD THIS NEW LOGGER TO STOP LOG SPAM
log4j.logger.com.atlassian.mail.incoming.mailfetcherservice = WARN, incomingmaillog
{code}
fields.summary: mailfetcherservice log message filling up catalina.out
